message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12,000. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to you is $8,000.
I appreciate your offer, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I was thinking of making an offer of $9,000. I believe this is a more reasonable price considering the product's worth to me is $8,000.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your concerns, but I still believe the product is worth more than $9,000 to me. I'm willing to compromise and offer it to you for $10,500. This is a fair price considering its value to you and the value it holds for me.

I understand your compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $10,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's worth to me is $8,000.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob. However, I'm still not willing to sell the product for $10,000. I'm willing to make another compromise and offer it to you for $11,000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering its value to me.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to go a bit higher and offer $10,500. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's worth to me is $8,000.

I understand your persistence, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to go a bit higher. However, I'm still not willing to sell the product for $10,500. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer it to you for $11,500. This is the final price I'm willing to accept, considering its value to me.
I'm getting close to walking away from the deal, Alice. I'm willing to make one last offer of $11,000. If you're not willing to accept this, I'll have to reconsider the deal and look elsewhere.

I understand your urgency, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to make one last offer. However, I'm still not willing to sell the product for $11,000. I'm willing to make a final compromise and offer it to you for $12,000. This is the absolute lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering its value to me.

I'm sorry, Alice, but I've reached my limit. I'm not willing to pay $12,000 for the product. I'm going to have to walk away from the deal and look elsewhere. I'll consider buying the product from John for $8,000 instead.
